ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] jboots?
ygData.msgSnippet: Talk to Hasten Bootstrutter who can be found in the Rathe Mountains. He has an extra pair of Journeyman Boots, but would rather trade than sell it. You must
ygData.messageBody:
Talk to Hasten Bootstrutter who can be found in the Rathe Mountains. He has
an extra pair of Journeyman Boots, but would rather trade than sell it. You
must seek out the following items and hand them to him.


* Shadowed Rapier

* Ring of the Ancients

* 3250 Gold

The shadowed rapier can be found all around Norrath dropped by those Shadow
Men. I suggest getting this piece last since it will disapear from your
inventory when you camp. For the Ring of the Ancients, it spawns on an
Ancient Cyclops in South Ro. Also make sure you hand him 3250 Gold and not
325 Platinum as this will not work.

These boots do not have to be worn to be activated. Just right click on them
and they will bestow great speed to the user, almost like the Spirit of the
Wolf spell.

-----Original Message-----
From: Danspath [mailto:danspth@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 08, 2001 8:01 AM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [EverQuest] jboots?




I thought JBoots did not proc until a certain level? I assume the trick to
getting them requires multiquesting with a higher level?


Dan


"Nygaardr, FC3" <nygaardr@...> wrote:





If you have Jboots you can kill dwarfs in BB, they are lvl 35 but if you
have boots you can kite them until fear sticks, ideally you should be around
lvl 36 I would imagine for melee b/c they do hit hard and fast 9x double and
triple but fast 6 minute spawns, if you can darkness and fear you shouldn't
have much problem killing them not sure if your spells will stick or not
dont have a SK.



Try Overthere as well, fear works nice in several spots there dont even need
to waste mana with darkness, considered a bug by some however I think not.
Fear them into the wall facing the steps they wont leave from that spot as
long as a melee is beating on them from behind if you dont hit them they
will slide off and eventually, usually, down past the stairs and back to
full speed.



Very nice place to solo with an enchanter, or other classes that can fear
but not snare/darkness (are there any others? Cleric I guess maybe more dont
think so), just need to make sure you dont get hit by the mob before you get
back to where you want to fight or you will wind up fighting a mob out in
the middle of the zone and not near the safety of the wall.



Why solo though? So many places to find groups as a Tank I would think,
Solb comes to mind not too crowded on my server any more, except for the
bugs which are always camped b/c they are so easy to kill (low hps). Always
seems to be some Monk in there soloing bats and beetles.



Rambled long enough.



Mu





-----Original Message-----
From: Danspath [mailto:danspth@...]
Sent: Wednesday, March 07, 2001 5:01 PM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Leaving EQ




Lance, I'd agree with you...except if you look at the traffic on this list,
it mainly is for account transactions.



So change it - bring up a topic. What shall we discuss? I'd love to hear
about solid soloing spots for lv 32-35. Right now my shadow knight is
soloing effectivly in Lake of Ill Omen but am starting to hit too many
greens. But critters in FM far undercon.



Lance Whitmore <vesuvus@...> wrote:




I only ask that you have a little respect for those of
us who wish the channel to remain as it is.. not a
habor for the selling of your wares.. but for the
sharing of information.

Many have left this listserv for the very reason. I
dont care if you wish to sell your account, however,
this is not the place for it.. thanks..

Lance

--------

And perhaps you should stop playing police-man and
mind your own business.
Just a thought!
